article_title: Idaho lawmakers at turning point on health care for poor
article_text:
Bill up for a hearing this week authorizes state to seek federal assistance for 78,000

With federal waiver, Idaho could try cost-saving, community-based managed care program

Legislature has off-ramps to get out, if things don’t work out

article_metadata.news-keywords: Medicaid expansion, Fred Wood, Obamacare, Idaho, Lynn Luker, Health care, Legislature, ID, Iowa, capitol, otter, bedke, hill, medicaid, medicare
article_metadata.description: The legislative debate in Idaho over expanding Medicaid to provide health care for the poor reaches a significant milepost this week when a committee moves as early as Monday to authorize an application seeking federal approval for a modified, federally funded program. If approved later this week by the House and Senate, it will be the most significant action on health care in Idaho since the creation of the state health insurance exchange under Obamacare.
article_metadata.title: Idaho lawmakers at turning point on health care for poor | Idaho Statesman
